description.narrative: By the end of 2022, Federal and states governments have increased capability to identify and use fiscal space to implement policies and programs to reduce multidimensional poverty, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2022, government at federal and state level has implemented NSPP and fiscal policies progressively achieving greater equality

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2022, Federal and states governments have increased capability to identify and use fiscal space to implement policies and programs to reduce multidimensional poverty

description.narrative: Federal and selected states governments have made progress in acquiring capacity to improve local development planning and to identify and use fiscal space to implement policies and programs reducing multidimensional poverty. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of states with measurement of the share of public spending in health, education, nutrition, child protection, WASH and/or social protection benefiting children in households living in the poorest LGA and/or the poorest quintile
Number of states with studies and analyses measuring/presenting fiscal space for social investment for children

3.4 Nationally owned measurement of the share of public spending in health, education and/or social protection benefiting children in households living in the poorest region and/or the poorest quintile is in place for use in policy development
3.2 Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children
3.3 Strengthened capacity of stakeholders in budgeting at all levels of government to improve spending outcomes for children
Existence of studies and analyses measuring/presenting fiscal space for social investment for children at federal level
